title: PC-Agent: A Hierarchical Multi-Agent Collaboration Framework for Complex Task Automation on PC
author: Haowei Liu (Institute of Automation, Chinese Academy of Sciences), Xi Zhang (Alibaba Group), Haiyang Xu (Alibaba Group), Yuyang Wanyan (Institute of Automation, Chinese Academy of Sciences), Junyang Wang (Beijing Jiaotong University), Ming Yan (Alibaba Group), Ji Zhang (Alibaba Group), Chunfeng Yuan (Institute of Automation, Chinese Academy of Sciences)
relevance_why: The paper discusses a hierarchical framework for automation on personal computers, which could synergize with audio-language models that Haohe Liu develops, particularly in task automation related to audio generation and manipulation.
background: The task is to automate complex workflows on personal computers using multiple collaborating agents to interpret user commands efficiently.
contribution: This paper introduces the PC-Agent framework to solve automation complexities in personal computing, achieving a 32% absolute improvement in task success rate over existing methods.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing methods lack effective perception and decision-making in complex, interdependent tasks across applications.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by employing a hierarchical multi-agent architecture for task decomposition and a reflection mechanism that enhances decision-making accuracy.

key_innovation: Combines an Active Perception Module with a hierarchical multi-agent collaboration structure to efficiently break down and manage complex user instructions.
real_world_impact: The framework promises to streamline productivity and task execution in PC environments, making it easier for users to perform complex operations without manual input.

new_terms.Active Perception Module: **Active Perception Module** enhances the agent's ability to understand and interact with the graphical user interface by refining its perception of interactive elements and text.
new_terms.Hierarchical Multi-Agent Collaboration: **Hierarchical Multi-Agent Collaboration** is an architecture where multiple agents work at different levels to manage task decomposition, tracking progress, and executing actions efficiently.

open_sourcing: The code will be publicly available.
